DOC.brief_title: Intravenous Lidocaine Versus Morphine Severe Pain ED
DOC.detailed_description: Objective : The purpose pilot study determine analgesic efficacy intravenous lidocaine versus morphine treatment severe pain emergency department ( ED ) . Study design : Open-label , randomize , control pilot trial . Participants : Investigators research assistant recruit patient ≥18 year old severe pain ( NRS ≥7 ) anticipate stay emergency department ≥1 hour . A sample size calculation perform 32 patient enrol . Intervention : After train research assistant obtain write informed consent , eligible participant randomize intravenous lidocaine morphine arm study . In intravenous lidocaine arm , patient receive IV lidocaine ( 75 mg < 50kg , 100 mg 50 - 100 kg , 150 mg > 100 kg ) 10 minute 100 mL normal saline minibag follow 50 minute IV lidocaine drip ( 75 mg < 50kg , 100 mg 50 - 100 kg , 150 mg > 100 kg ) . In morphine arm , ED provider choose appropriate dose morphine patient . At 20 40 minute , participant ask `` Would like additional pain medication ? '' . Participants respond affirmative receive morphine 4 mg IV . Data collection : The trained research assistant collect data patient ' pain score , side effect , rescue morphine . Statistical analysis : Investigators perform descriptive statistic compare pain score pain relief time point unpaired t-tests .
